Mayor de Blasio Announces New Face Covering Guidance and Public Awareness Campaign to Reach Younger New Yorkers Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/514-20/mayor-de-blasio-new-face-covering-guidance-public-awareness-campaign-reach-younger

Jul 13, 2020-Mayor de Blasio today announced that all New Yorkers should wear a face covering indoors when they are around other people

Related Links:

  • New Yorkers looking to get tested should text COVID TEST to 855-48 or visit NYC.gov/COVIDTEST Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/514-20/mayor-de-blasio-new-face-covering-guidance-public-awareness-campaign-reach-younger

Mayor de Blasio Kicks Off COVID-19 Testing Day of Action to Encourage New Yorkers to Get Tested Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/506-20/mayor-de-blasio-kicks-off-covid-19-testing-day-action-encourage-new-yorkers-get-tested

Jul 8, 2020-With the goal of testing 150,000 New Yorkers over the next week, Mayor de Blasio today kicked off the City's COVID-19 day of action.

Related Links:

  • New Yorkers should go to nyc.gov/covidtest or text COVID TEST to 855-48 and provide your zip code to find a nearby site Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/506-20/mayor-de-blasio-kicks-off-covid-19-testing-day-action-encourage-new-yorkers-get-tested

Mayor de Blasio and Taskforce on Racial Inclusion and Equity Announce Accelerated Internet Master Plan to Support Communities Hardest-Hit by COVID-19 Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/499-20/mayor-de-blasio-taskforce-racial-inclusion-equity-accelerated-internet-master

Jul 7, 2020-Mayor de Blasio announces that the City will accelerate broadband deployment in all five boroughs, prioritizing public housing communities

Related Links:

  • Broadband deployment will connect 600,000 New Yorkers to jobs, training, education, mental health supports and healthcare resources from home Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/499-20/mayor-de-blasio-taskforce-racial-inclusion-equity-accelerated-internet-master

Jul 7, 2020-Mayor Bill de Blasio today unveiled the first set of "Cool Streets" for this summer

Related Links:

  • Cool It! NYC program will expand cooling options on existing Open Streets with tree-based shade and hydrants, focusing on heat-burdened communities Link: https://www1.nyc.gov/office-of-the-mayor/news/500-20/as-summer-enters-full-swing-new-york-city-builds-cool-streets-nation-leading-open-streets

Related Links:

  • Mayor de Blasio today announced SYEP Summer Bridge 2020, a $51M public-private partnership that will provide constructive engagement and enrichment activities to keep 35,000 New York City youth active and productive this summer.
